intro: Klasea integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf klasea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are broad, smooth, and have a distinct, mild peppery scent. Klasea integrifolia produces small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
